website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for customers who want support at both the toilet and sink and have full use of both their arms.
pros: Freestanding design allows safety rail to be used at the toilet or sink
Provides safe support while sitting or standing
cons: Can tip if user does not grip and exert equal pressure on both sides
Not ideal for users with partial paralysis

customer_reviews.title: Reviews of this item led me to believe it was very sturdy. However
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased to make a bathroom safer for my spouse who has mobility issues due to a stroke. Reviews of this item led me to believe it was very sturdy. However, we have discovered, after he used the rails to help himself arise from his throne, that if you are NOT able to exert EQUAL pressure constantly on BOTH sides at the SAME time while PUSHING up (he has partial paralysis on left side) the support WILL TIP sideways. He took a bad tumble into the bathtub head first. This is a very $$$$ item and is unreturnable!!!! I can not recommend this product for anyone who may have weak sided issues.
customer_reviews.author: Beepar

customer_reviews.title: Blocks Toliet Lever. Disappointed with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to put together and seems sturdy enough. The BIG down side is... the bars across the back sit directly in front of the toilet lever. I purchased this for someone that needs assistance standing due to back pain. Every time she uses the bathroom she needs to move the unit to be able to flush the toilet. This sits EXACTLY smack in front of the toilet lever on my Kohler comfort height toilet. VERY DISAPPOINTED with product seeing it said it is for ALL toilets. If I would of known I would not have purchased this product! Can't flush toilet without moving the safety rail unit away from the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what we need. My girlfriend broke her ankle and cannot put any weight on that foot for eight weeks. She was having problems using the bathroom and then getting up and sitting down. We looked at a few products but them seemed unstable or wobbly. This product is sturdy, flexible and easy to use. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Warren C Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great safety device for seniors and those with balance issues.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this item yesterday. Purchased for my 80 year old father who has balance issues and weakness in legs. The rails help him maintain his balance and helps him to stand up. He likes it, says it makes him feel safer. I like that it gives him more independence especially in the middle of the night when having to use the bathroom. Only concern with the product is it does wobble slightly. Must put equal amount of weight on handles when using. Like that it's not bolted to toilet so it's easy to move when cleaning bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Marce

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a help.
customer_reviews.text: Did some research before buying to find the best type of safety rail for my husband. It's very sturdy and has 4 adjustable legs that fit over the commode. Makes for a nice height adjustment. Not only does my husband like it but I do too. Definitely a big help. It did arrive with a broken safety clip. After contacting the company, this was easily resolved.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBoots

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good and it's easy to remove
customer_reviews.text: These stand-alone safety rails were very easy to assemble and put in place and they're easy to remove. I like that the grips are rubber. Overall, the rails are pretty stable -- but you should always place both hands on the grips when sitting down or getting up. The absence of a cross bar going in front of the toilet has the advantage that there isn't something getting in the way of your feet when you're sitting on the toilet. During assembly, I had to use the lowest setting (for the legs) for my mother who is on the short side (4' 11"). Overall, I'm quite satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Was missing the hardware. My husband had to go buy more from the hardware store. The arms wobble back and forth, but not so much that it would collapse. Sturdy enough for my 270lb self to use in the bathroom for 2 months after ankle surgery. Gave me back independence in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: CMandara

customer_reviews.title: Toliet Safety Rails
customer_reviews.text: Product is very sturdy and very easy to assemble, Hand rails have a soft cushion for ease and comfort, after several differnt products i wish i saw this one first, i would have saved some money. My partner has MS and has daily struggles with balance and this is a life saver when using the toliet. Made of strong steal, and can be easily adjusted for differnt hieights, as it is not attached to the toliet which is great as i have 2 bathrooms and this can easily be moved as it folds with ease. I can also teke it with us when we travel.
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: it works without being attached to the toilet.
customer_reviews.text: This item worked well in a small bathroom with the toilet very close to the bath tub. The rails needed to be such that did not need to be anchored to the toilet. This item worked well and is stable enough to move from toilet to walker and from walker to toilet. This item can be removed without disassembly and then put back.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Ann Bose

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This works much better than the previous rails I bought. The other had a stabilizing bar at the bottom in front which prevented my dad from getting close enough to the bowl to do his business without peeing in the floor which resulted in a lot of embarrassment and cleaning. This system doesn't have that problem but unfortunately if Dad grabs it vigorously while standing it will cause the toilet lid to come crashing down. This doesn't happen often but when it does the results are seriously bad. For the most parts this is an acceptable product - the best of a bunch of no good alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I read all the previous reviews. This is exactly what I wanted/hoped it would be. I like that I can pick it up and move quickly if I need to (cleaning). While we hate that we need it, the beauty in aging is doing it gracefully and getting help where needed.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie M

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Read lots of reviews on this, but my experience with my sister was not good. She had a very hard time getting up with this. She had leg weakness and this did not support her enough to get up. We adjusted the height several times to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Dapn

customer_reviews.title: Six Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. The unit was purchased to assist my wife in getting up and down to use the toilet. She was so pleased to use the unit and said it has been ages since she got down and up with so little pain. The best part is that it saves my back from lifting. This has to be one of the best purchases I have ever made to make my wife more comfortable . If six stars were available That is what my rating would be.
customer_reviews.author: Jussi

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2, one for each bathroom to use during husband's recovery from injury and surgery. He refused to use a portable commode. After measuring carefully and comparing available models, I chose this. We are happy with them. The cross bar at back can fit behind the raised seat cover, and the padded, curved handles are comfortable to use. Adjustable height was important too. The folding feature is a plus, because we can store them away when not needed or guests are using one bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Stable and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this safety rail system because I was having two knee replacement surgeries. Though I have a tall toilet there was nothing in my bathroom to brace for standing. This system has proven most beneficial. I am well past my surgeries but continue to use the safety rail to assist me. I am fairly heavy for my height but this system has not faltered once in several months use. It is very stable and a terrific assist to air in standing.
customer_reviews.author: G. Casper

customer_reviews.title: This rail fits perfectly and is very sturdy. It helps her get up easily and (bonus
customer_reviews.text: This item is just what we needed. We have a taller toilet in my aging mother's restroom, but even with that, she was always having to brace herself with the counter on one side and the edge of the bath tub on the other. This rail fits perfectly and is very sturdy. It helps her get up easily and (bonus!) helps encourage her to sit down squarely, which ensures that everything is in the proper alignment with the seat and that helps keep the floor and toilet seat clean. It can also be folded with minimal effort so we can pack it to take when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: W. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom and it couldn't be more perfect for her! She absolutely loves this! I love that it is portable too! I didn't want anything that I had to attach to the toilet. It took less than 10 minutes to set up. It fits perfectly in her bathroom and it's very stable. No more struggling to get on and off the toiled seat! I highly recommend this product and you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before making this purchase. I was looking for a safety rail to put around the toilet, rather than attaching a permanent grab bar. With these things, I wanted to make sure it was sturdy and was a good quality. These have both. I also like that you can adjust the height because my dad is a big tall guy. These are withstanding all his weight nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Barness

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for helping but not depending on stability.
customer_reviews.text: This toilet safety rail is just perfect for someone who needs just a little help getting off and on the toilet. I like that it is not fastened to the toilet, but just sits perfectly behind the toilet lid. It's easy to assemble and clean. It was great when my 91 year-old mother was a few years younger and just needed a little help getting up and down. Now that she is very wobbly, I will get one that attaches to the toilet for more stability. But I still highly recommend this one. Such a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bev Bruce

customer_reviews.title: A Safe And Useful Product
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy product was easy to assemble. Basically, all I had to do was unfold it and make sure it was set at the right height. One thing I really wanted was a safe and secure product which did not have to be attached in any way to the toilet or to the toilet seat. This one fit the bill. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: janets98

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself for my bilateral knee replacements. I wanted rails I would not have to attach to the toilet itself, and these are exactly what I wanted. Sturdy, easy to assemble, adjustable, and does not interfere in any way with existing bathroom. I used a bit of packing material to cover the rear bar where it could make contact with the tank. A tiny bit of protection, just in case. Looks fine. Works great! As a bonus, the rails are also useful for an elderly relative who lives with us. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Steele

customer_reviews.title: Products like this can make all the difference. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This product is really helping out an ill family member. I assembled it (easily) and tested it, and it works as advertised. I also like that it has so much height adjustability; my relative really needs that in order to get the best mix of initial "lift-off" and standing support. I would recommend this product, and I would also suggest trying an elevated toilet seat for those who can use even more assistance. Good luck. I hope it helps make your life a little easier too.
customer_reviews.author: John Arthur Lee (fiction writer)

customer_reviews.title: Came in handy for me.
customer_reviews.text: I had a bedside potty that we put over the toilet but it didn't fit well and wasn't ideal. This gives you the hand rails to help you get up without getting in the way of the toilet bowl. Because it is not attached to the toilet in any way, it is not as stable as some people may need. I knew that so I adjusted where I grabbed it when getting up.
customer_reviews.author: Diane M

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Design for Elderly Visitors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my home so when my mother is visiting, she can feel safe using my bathroom. Other designs required the rail to be attached to the toilet which would be extremely inconvenient for removal and storage when not needed. It is very easy to put together and adjust. When the safety rail is not needed, the locking pins easily remove to be stored in a bathroom drawer, and the rail folds nicely to be stored away in any closet. It can fit in my master closet without folding. I do have to drop the legs, but that is easier than removing the locking pins.
customer_reviews.author: by S Allendorf

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. It fits well over our Toto commode. This is a good alternative when you have someone who has needed a raised seat in the past but now just wants something strong to hold onto. It is holding up well!
customer_reviews.author: B. Wickham

customer_reviews.title: Quick way to add grab bars to any toilet.
customer_reviews.text: Used as grab bars on chair height elongated toilet. These were quick to put together and fairly stable if using both arms. Little narrow for larger person but easy to quickly move to new location. And removal of 4 clips makes the unit foldable for storage and travel
customer_reviews.author: Retired software tester

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy around toilet for those with bad knees.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I have bad knees and am female, so I have to sit down each time I use the bathroom. This is perfect for me to grab onto to sit and get up. I am getting one knee replaced next week so am especially glad to have it. It is surprisingly sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Dented and damaged product
customer_reviews.text: I disliked that this product came to me damaged and had brown colored residue on the bottoms of the safety rails, and the metal rails were dented.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: The safety rail is super sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: My 68 year old husband is a large man. Due to reconstructive foot surgery he has been 100% non weight bearing on that leg. He uses a wheelchair and walker to enter the bathroom. This safety rail allows him to use the bathroom independently after Occupational therapist trained him. The safety rail is super sturdy and reliable. He can lift himself up without putting the pressure on the commode. I like that it is easy to move out of the way so I can clean properly. The safety rail was very simple to assemble. I plan to purchase a second rail for the our master bath when he can move back upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: cf

customer_reviews.title: Highly functional product; stable
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most products for seniors' use, this one is very practical, stable, easy to adjust its height, and perfectly fit the geometry of our elongated (oval) toilet. Highly recommended for anyone needing assistance with standing up.
customer_reviews.author: hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Not very expensive, very handy.
customer_reviews.text: Used it daily since purchase, after my knee surgery it has been a life saver. I use it to move from one side of the room to the other, for lowering down to use the toilet and even fits in my shower. Not really made to be a walker, you can use it as such as long as you aren't pushing 200+lbs. I'm 6ft 187lbs and all 4 legs are adjustable, gets a little wobbly after putting weight on it. More use for it as a support frame.
customer_reviews.author: ID I Am

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow. 2” narrower than description
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a good product but if you need a wider set up don’t get this one.
customer_reviews.author: JerryB12

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but didn't fit area where I needed to use it
customer_reviews.text: I works but is a little large for the space around my toilet so others in the household weren't happy with it. The back bar gets in the way as it won't fit behind the toilet. I should have looked at size before I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST SAFETY RAIL...
customer_reviews.text: I had a total knee replacement and needed an aid to use the toilet. This safety rail couldnt be better!!! It is so easy to assemble, and it does NOT attach to the toilet seat. it just slides back over the toilet. It is very sturdy and the height is adjustable. Plus, because it doesnt attach to the toilet using the toilet screws, I am able to use it in any bathroom, upstairs or down. It is a bit more expensive than some, but I always believe you get what you pay for, and this is the best safety rail you could have!!!
customer_reviews.author: DebL.

customer_reviews.title: A Sturdy Device ThT Performs Well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for elderly mother who was having problems standing from a low apartment toilet. The device arrived on the promised date. It assembled easily without tools. It has easy button style height adjusters. It stands solidly. It did not require me to unfasten the toilet seat to install it. In a matter of five minutes it was assembled and in place. The top is angled to make it easy to grasp and push down while sitting or standing. My mother thanks me for getting it for her nearly every day. I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Veteran Teacher

customer_reviews.title: 5star product!
customer_reviews.text: love love this product I suffered a stroke 3yrs ago and still have little to no movement on my left side this product has made toileting so much easier and safer highly recommend and would buy againlove love this product I suffered a stroke 3yrs ago and still have little to no movement on my left side this product has made toileting so much easier and safer highly recommend and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Robin Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Moves around.
customer_reviews.text: Portable, but no way to secure to toilet, so it moves around.
customer_reviews.author: Brad W

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Tool To Have More Independence
customer_reviews.text: Very necessary to use/have in the bathroom after my foot surgery. Sitting or standing up is impossible without this when using the commode or at various places in my bathroom. It is not anchored down so be careful. It does not take the place of a wheel chair, knee scooter or crutches but it is necessary for me when standing up or sitting down. It is light enough for me to move it around in my bathroom. I am so thankful I ordered it. It allows more independence in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: cherryroses

customer_reviews.title: Veey handy, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Toilet seat cover stays up when you need it to. Feels very stable. Takes up a little more room than the "installed to seat cover" type, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tish A.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It is very stable. It requires no installation, only assembly. It is easy to remove for cleaning. It is very wide so be mindful if you are working in a tight space. Cross bar sits against tank so, may be a some toilet lid issues staying up if the toilet is exceptionally compact.
customer_reviews.author: F5711

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Grandfather, it is built very sturdy and makes it much easier for him to get up and down. I only gave this 4 stars because the sellers says it is 17" deep, but as other reviewers have mentioned it is not and can be a trip hazard with the legs coming out beyond the toilet bowl. I was able to turn the back brace around and put right up against the toilet tank which then brought the legs in so that I don't have to worry about Grandpa tripping.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with Carex Toilet Safety Rails
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Good quality. I set it up where the only wall is behind the toilet. I am 5'9" and my wife is 5' so I set the height at 27 inches for her. As to criticism about the unit not being wide enough, I have no problem. As for the claim that it is not stable if you don't use two hands, I find it to be safe with one hand as long as I push down and not outward. It's a good product to use where you don't want to install wall grab bars.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: poor design
customer_reviews.text: back crossbars are too thick; unable to keep toilet seat and cover up. also whenever you grab side support bars, the whole unit tends to move shift.
customer_reviews.author: BubbaBee

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommond
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, No need to modify anything just sits right on top of the back rim. Sets up in a snap and folds down when not needed. Stays put, very sturdy and strong, adjusts to desired height. I used this after my knee replacement and was a life saver in getting me up and down.
customer_reviews.author: C.G.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed bathroom safety support
customer_reviews.text: Great bathroom assist for family member with mobility issues. It does not need to be attached to the toilet. The toilet seat easily raises and lowers with this railing in place. It has fit with every toilet in the house, plus person took it with them when staying at another person's home. It provides great support and doesn't get in the way for others to use the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: GL

customer_reviews.title: Stable and works great for grandma!
customer_reviews.text: Stability is not an issue, product is sturdy and fits well behind the toilet seat. This is a life saver for my grandmother and has made her feel more confident about using the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was needed
customer_reviews.text: This literally took 5 minutes to assemble, no tools required. Just snap on 4 C-clamps and attach the legs with 4 screws and that's it. The height was perfect and no adjustments of any kind were needed. As long as your toilet has room behind the seat so there is clearance for the lid when up, this product will work. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: DrLisaS

customer_reviews.title: fits the need
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble - no tools needed. Fits perfectly, and the cover will stay up when raised. No problem with room to do that. Really nice...and it is great to be able to remove it easily for cleaning around commode.
customer_reviews.author: Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my Mom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom after she had surgery. She needed something to help her get up and down when using the toilet. This works very well.
customer_reviews.author: CMH

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to assemble. Very sturdy, it makes moms visit more doable because of her challenge getting up from sitting position. I'd purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good support for elderly mother
customer_reviews.text: The quality appears to be good. I went with this style versus the one that fastens to the toilet seat lid since I read that prolonged use of that style could loosen the wax seal on the bottom of the toilet. This is s free-standing style and offers good support. It was easy to assemble as well--no tools required!
customer_reviews.author: celtic piper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you don't want to install anything
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for me since I didn't want to install anything on my toilet. I had ankle surgery and was NWB for 8 weeks, so I could use the rails to get up and down. However, if you put all of your weight on one side, it will tip over. I knew it was unstable because of other reviews so I knew NOT to put all my weight on one side so it worked very well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy; however.......
customer_reviews.text: Made sturdy with comfortable handles. However would have been good if it were made to be able to adjust the width between handles. Manufacturer needed to realize people need to clean oneself if using it for toilet support and there is no room to do that. Luckily, husband was able to modify with his ingenuity.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my elderly Dad going into assisted living. He's 94, in heart failure, and very weak. It's been steady for him to use. Using at my house while he stays with us. It is steady enough and plan to take when he moves. We did not want the type that attached to the toilet. Had concerns it could crack the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Quite sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom based on the reviews and she is very happy with it. She has enough support to lower herself as well as to get up. My mom is 86 and doesn't have the strength and balance she once did. This is sturdy and we have no problem lifting the toilet seat up and it does stay up - we have an elongated toilet bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Beancounter

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband.he is 6'1",weight 180lb.and has parkinsons desease.it was very easy to assemble and set up.it has about 7 inches in height adjustment.it is very study and all the weight is on the floor,not the commode.both lid and seat can be raised and stay up with no problems.my husband loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Lorraine Walker

customer_reviews.title: Medical Necessity
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as an aid after surgery. Overall, good product...just wish it was foldable for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: It’s seems to be well made. After tightening up the screws I felt it was stable enough. Fits over any size toilet.
customer_reviews.author: miss book

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Well-made and heavier construction than expected. It assembled very easily and is a welcome addition for stability in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: painter

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Toto bidet toilet seat!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works really well with my bidet toilet seat. Other safety rails would require that I remove the bidet. This gives me the best of both worlds....the security of the safety rails and the cleanliness & comfort that comes from using the bidet!
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Best investment I've ever made for my tired, aging body.
customer_reviews.text: Due to badly worn knees, I have problems standing from a seated position. My favorite seat in the house used to cause me a lot of pain trying to get off it -- until I discovered the wonders of this Carex Safety Rail. Extreme adjustability and sturdiness are the hallmarks of this exemplar of modern engineering. My new best friend!
customer_reviews.author: jabit

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Very fine packaging, ease of putting together with the included instruction manual, 23” width makes for comfortable use at the toilet. Solid manufacturing and graded hand rails are flexible for persons of different heights. I added three plastic stick-on bumper pads so the back bars do not touch the porcelain toilet tank.
customer_reviews.author: Chaplain Mary F. Bettencourt

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: The rail works okay for support, but it is too narrow. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my 93 year old mom. It is a great design; free-standing so it can be moved as necessary for cleaning, etc. I needed it in a hurry, so ordered one day shipping and it arrived the next day. We have this on an elongated and chair-height commode. Very happy with the service and product.
customer_reviews.author: J in Mecosta

customer_reviews.title: Easy too assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy too assemble. Excellent for someone who need help getting up from toilet. Handle Bars are rubberized for a firm grip. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Assists people in getting on and off the toilet
customer_reviews.text: My relative uses this to assist him in getting on and off the toilet. It provides the stability he needs . I gave it a 4 because the right leg is a little shaky and can't be tightened. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Tona J Mills

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful in my recovery from surgery.
customer_reviews.text: This was a wonderful aid to my recovery from a knee replacement. Sits loosely at the back of the toilet but sturdy enough for me me to get up and down safely. Easy to move out for bathroom cleaning. Affordable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larson

customer_reviews.title: and the foam handle is nice and soft for my husband's arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my husband with mobility problem, getting in and out of the toilet with nothing to grab on to has become problematic. I have a bidet unit installed on the right side of the toilet, so I was looking for a safety rail that would work and that I don't have to install or attach to the back of toilet. I took a chance on this item, and it works perfectly, the side bar on the right did not obstruct the bidet unit, and the foam handle is nice and soft for my husband's arthritic hands. It arrived in an timely manner, and it is easily assembled without any tool.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: great helper
customer_reviews.text: helps you get on and off the toilet and out of a chair after having a total knee replacement. very stable. well built and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: camaroman

customer_reviews.title: Money wasted
customer_reviews.text: A complete nightmare to put it together. The holes don't fit. You would have to use a hammer and other tools forever to get it all together. It's good when it's all together but it was impossible for me to put it together I can't imagine how my senior-dad or any senior would be able to put it together easily.
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This support really works. It fits right over the toilet, with the back bar resting against the tank, with perfect amount of room behind the raised lid. It is sturdy and solid, and provides the leverage a disabled person needs to raise up and lower down. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a small bathroom. It fits well, easy to assemble and easy to move around if needed. I read other reviews that other buyers like this product and so I decided to buy this product. The only thing I didn't like was the price, a bit high compare to other brands of safety rail support.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Both feel comfortable and safe using it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my elderly parents. One is under 100 lbs, the other is over 250 lbs. Both feel comfortable and safe using it. It was very easy to assemble (Mom did it herself ). It is very stable. I was thinking that I would have to find a way to anchor it to the floor to ensure that it did not shift. As it turns out I did not need to. I can put all of my weight (150 lbs) on the front most part of the handles and it does not move. Adjustable height is a nice feature. 4 legs instead of 2 was also a selling feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, easy to put together as it was halfway together already, took less than 15 minutes. I like that the legs are height adjustable and that it doesn't attach to the toilet so we can store it away when it is not needed anymore. Feels sturdy and I like that it has 4 legs instead of 2 like the ones that you attach. The back frame doesn't interfere with putting the cover up.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Smith

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: My husband had a DOUBLE knee replacement. This product was necessary for his rehab.
customer_reviews.author: Chrise

customer_reviews.title: A good choice of free-standing grab bars
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar set works very dependably. I am using it in our very small bathroom as assistance for using the toilet. I am almost 300 lbs. and this always feels sturdy. It is free-standing and moveable but when I actually have my hands on it supporting myself, it doesn't move. It assembled easily and adjusting the height is easy too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy assembly, assistance to keep you independent.
customer_reviews.text: Since I already have an elevated toilet, these rails are working perfectly! When sitting or standing up , please be sure you have equal arm strength to use properly. These rails do not create an inconvenience for your guests also.
customer_reviews.author: Alice N

customer_reviews.title: Stable safety rail!!
customer_reviews.text: Came handy for my mother after surgery- works great in conjunction with raised toilet sit. The hight is adjustable and easy to assemble, can also double as the stability support at the sink when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sent a used, damaged item.
customer_reviews.text: This item was previously used, box was opened and taped back up, some parts had rust on them, rubber hand grips had rips/tears in them, bottom of padded feet had noticeable wear! Not very happy with product, would send back but mother in law is in need of this. I would like a replacement item and then i will return this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frederick R Rappuhn

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Item
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father. He loves it and can easily get up off the toilet. We like it because it does not attach to toilet and you can move it around. Appears to be pretty stable, though you have to have your weight pretty evenly distributed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bingo!
customer_reviews.text: This was worth every penny. Our space width from wall to sink is 28". Our toilet is elongated. The device is stable on four legs, It's easy to remove for company. I'm thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed at hand!
customer_reviews.text: I just had major foot surgery. I ordered this because I liked that I could use it in the downstairs during they day and upstairs at night since it's not permanently attached! It feels pretty sturdy, though I do get a slight wobble. But that could be my floor. Easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.author: Velikova

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: This item has been a life saver after my husband had lower back surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Ladysyl

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This safety rail is well-built and sturdy. It was easy to assemble, and did not require attachment to the toilet. Each leg is adjustable to accommodate most toilets. I recommend this safety rail if you do not want to install wall-mounted rails or toilet-mounted rails.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Exactly what I needed for my knee replacement surgery. Good size, not too small and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B. Holley

customer_reviews.title: This is more sturdy than I anticipated
customer_reviews.text: This is more sturdy than I anticipated. I got it for my grandmother who just had hip replacement surgery. She can use it while getting up off the toilet and also when standing up from her shower bench after a shower. I weigh about 185 and it held my entire weight. So I'm confident grandma will be okay getting up and down.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Perfect support for my daughter after she was in an accident.
customer_reviews.author: J. Milliken

customer_reviews.title: It is adjustable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This product is just what I needed. At home I have grab bars installed but when I travel I can run into difficulty in some bathrooms, especially if they are not ADA height. This product can fit into the trunk of the car. It is adjustable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jackson

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: As a recent amputee, I ordered this item to help with my toileting. The biggest reason I went with it is it is free standing but offers 4 legs support and can handle a lot of weight. No holes in walls for railings, no stress on the actual toilet from the getting up and down. Also portable so it will travel with me. Feel very safe using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Handsome safety rail
customer_reviews.text: I have a very contemporary grey & white bath and this safety rail is quite handsome. I had put off getting one because I did not want an ugly "old lady" safety rail (I am an "old lady" of 80). Easy to assemble & comfortable to use. VERY PLEASED
customer_reviews.author: BJB

customer_reviews.title: Has saved my wife from falling on a couple occasions ...
customer_reviews.text: Has saved my wife from falling on a couple occasions. Sturdier than the ones that attach to the toilet at the seat bolts in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: I got this for recovery from surgery. What I like is that since it is free standing other family members can choose to use it or move it out of the way. Easy to assemble and easy to move to another room when company comes. The folding feature will come in handy for storage just remove 4 clips. Good tip from another reviewer, put the clips in a plastic bag and attach it to the Safety Rail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have if having mobility issues
customer_reviews.text: I broke my leg and have a small bathroom. These safety rails are a huge life saver for me. I can move them to my tub to help me get in and move them to the sink for help while getting ready in the morning or brushing my teeth. Crutches in the bathroom are just not that reliable so I very much recommend getting these. Plus the soft handles on top are nice and don't get too slippery when wet.
customer_reviews.author: V. Divi

customer_reviews.title: A HELPING RAIL
customer_reviews.text: comes in sections and was so easy to put together. height can be adjusted to fit the need of the recipient. i put it behind our toilet tank. the picture on the box shows it can be put behind the toilet seat but we had enough room to put it behind the tank. i would recommend this for anyone that needs a little help getting up from where you are sitting.
customer_reviews.author: BRIDGET

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: The item appears to be built well and will work to help my 91 year old mom get off the toilet. It arrived a day earlier than expected (hooray!) but it shipped without any hardware (urg!). We will use hardware from our collection because we need it now and really can't wait for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, this is the one.
customer_reviews.text: As an owner of a nursing home, I can attest as to the solid construction and top materials used on this safety rail. We previously tried 4 different brands, but all of them were either flimsy, not stable or difficult to clean. Having such bad experiences, I decided to only order one Carex Bathroom Rail and hope for the best. Upon arrival and after its installation, all of us at the nursing home were really impressed with it....hence, I just ordered three more.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge M. de la Torre

customer_reviews.title: Great. I felt it was more stable than the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great. I felt it was more stable than the one that is fastened on the toilet using the two seat bolts. And it is. Would recommend it to anyone having a problem. I'm using it and my wife has the problem.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT FAULKS

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: its a really nice product but it causes difficulty in flushing the toilet. you have to move it and the toilet lid goes down. its not a big thing just a little annoying
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy for someone who uses both hands to get up. Very easy to assemble. We purchased this safety frame along with a bidet Swash 400, and the combination of the two products together is gold, and allows for complete independence. Pretty awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this a zero I would - totally worthless. The holes don't line up - no way were the bolts going through both sides. I don't have a drill to fix it. Dry fit to see how it would adjust once placed - one leg about 3/8" shorter - rocks and is not stable.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Shank

product_meta.title: Carex Toilet Safety Rails - Toilet Handles for Elderly and Handicap - Home Health Care Equipment Toilet Safety Frame
product_meta.description: The bathroom safety rail easily fits around your toilet to provide safe support and assistance while sitting down or rising from the toilet. The toilet safety frame stands on its own without installation, so it can be used for added safety and stability all over the bathroom. With a 300 lbs weight capacity, the toilet safety frame provides a reliable and durable support system for anyone in need of added support. With an easy to use adjustable height, the toilet rails make it easy for multiple persons to use without having to purchase multiple frames. The stand alone toilet safety rail means it can be used for both the the toilet or sink and anywhere in the bathroom. Its capped feet prevent any scarring marks on the floor while providing a secure grip. With padded handles, the toilet safety rails offer added comfort when being used consistently. It's wide body adds convenience to anyone in need of converting their toilet to a handicap toilet seat with arms. The toilet safety frame weighs 9.65 lbs with dimensions of 27" - 33" x 23.25" x 20"
feature_bullets: TOILET HANDLES FOR ELDERLY: Toilet bars for elderly that are great for assisting seniors at the toilet or sink. Its mobility makes a great multi-use bathroom assistance product with easy to use and folding features.

HANDICAP GRAB BARS: Great safety device for handicap toilet or seniors who need a rail for support. It's durable frame makes it a reliable support system for anyone in need of added support while in the bathroom.

EASY ASSEMBLY: Toilet rails are easy to setup and install with no tools or installation needed. The toilet rail will be set up within minutes of setting up. It's design makes it able to fit around any standard toilet for easy use and assembly.
HEIGHT ADJUSTABLE: Toilet assist rails adjust from heights 27" to 33" to provide support for people of all heights. It can be easily adjusted for easy multi person use.
300 lbs WEIGHT CAPACITY: Toilet frame device that can handle persons weighing up to 300lbs for barbaric use making is ultra-reliable and sturdy for long term use.
